module.title: airson
module.p: airson for (the sake of) is a compound preposition, pronounced, and traditionally spelled, as two separate words, i.e. air son.
Some uses of airson are as follows –

ol.li: Purpose – dèan rud airson rud eile a dhèanamh do something in order to do something else, e.g. Chaidh mi a Ghlaschu airson cù a lorg I went to Glasgow to find a dog

Volition – bi airson want (somebody) to do something
bi airson rud a dhèanamh e.g. tha mi airson Màiri a phòsadh I want to marry Mary
bi airson gun dèan duine rud e.g. tha mi airson gum pòs Seumas Màiri I want James to marry Mary
See also: bi ag iarraidh want.

Duration – as an alternative to the pseudo-preposition fad, governing an indefinite noun denoting a time interval, and introducing a temporal adverbial phrase of duration – bha sinn pòsta airson bliadhna we were married for a year

box.title: dèan rud airson rud eile a dhèanamh
box.p: Purpose – do something in order to do something else

box.title: bi airson gun dèan duine rud
airson as a preposition of temporal duration
box.p: airson is sometimes used to introduce a time adverbial describing the duration of a state or activity. In these cases, airson governs an indefinite time noun, and modifies a verb describing an imperfective state or activity. For example –
This use of airson is likely due to the influence of English – the pseudo-preposition fad is probably more idiomatic in traditional Gaelic.
